radiographic_examinations.findings: Demonstrated diffusely dilated cortical veins suggestive of a dAVF; no intracranial hemorrhage, cerebral edema, or diffusion-weighted imaging abnormality.
Demonstrated diffusely dilated cortical veins suggestive of a dAVF; no intracranial hemorrhage, cerebral edema, or diffusion-weighted imaging abnormality.
Revealed left-sided slowing and attenuation, no epileptiform activity.
Showed decreased cerebral perfusion predominantly of the left frontoparietal cortex.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: A repeat brain SPECT scan demonstrated enhanced perfusion of the left frontoparietal lobe, especially the left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex after embolization.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Confirmed the presence of a giant high flow dAVF at the middle third of the SSS, with occlusion of the posterior SSS and straight and left transverse/sigmoid sinuses.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up angiogram at the time of embolization showed obliteration of the anomaly.
